availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John H. Wall (Union County, Kentucky, resident, farmer, soldier, and county clerk)

body.p: Union County, Kentucky, farmer, soldier, and court clerk. Harrison County, Kentucky, native. Son of George W. Wall and Frances M. January Wall. Resident of Union County in 1850. Farmer in Union County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Union County in 1860. Household owned an additional four enslaved persons in Union County in 1860. Served in the 2nd Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (C.S.A.) as a private and second lieutenant from August 23, 1861, to November 1, 1862. Served in the 10th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (C.S.A.) as first lieutenant from November 1, 1862, to May 29, 1865. Signed an oath the U.S. government on May 29, 1865. Clerk of the Union County Court.
